title: Campaign Spec Schema
description: Schema for GitHub Agentic Workflows campaign specifications

id.description: Unique identifier for the campaign (lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens only)

objective.description: Outcome-owned objective statement for the campaign (what success means)

kpis.description: Up to 3 KPIs used to measure the campaign objective

id.description: Optional stable identifier for the KPI (lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens)

priority.description: KPI priority: primary (exactly one per campaign) or supporting

unit.description: Optional KPI unit (e.g., percent, days, count)

time-window-days.description: Rolling time window, in days, used for KPI measurement (e.g., 7, 14, 30)

direction.description: Whether improvement means increasing or decreasing the KPI

source.description: Signal source used to compute this KPI

project-url.description: URL of the GitHub Project used as the primary campaign dashboard

project-github-token.description: Optional GitHub token expression used for GitHub Projects v2 operations (e.g., ${{ secrets.GH_AW_PROJECT_GITHUB_TOKEN }})

workflows.description: List of workflow IDs (basenames without .md) implementing this campaign

discovery-repos.description: List of repositories (in owner/repo format) where worker workflows are discovered. This controls the scope of GitHub searches for issues/PRs created by worker workflows.

discovery-orgs.description: List of GitHub organizations where worker workflows are discovered. When specified, any repository within these organizations is searched for worker-created issues/PRs.

allowed-repos.description: Optional list of repositories (in owner/repo format) that this campaign is allowed to discover and operate on. When omitted, defaults to the current repository where the campaign is defined.

allowed-orgs.description: Optional list of GitHub organizations that this campaign is allowed to discover and operate on

memory-paths.description: Paths where this campaign writes its repo-memory

metrics-glob.description: Glob pattern to locate JSON metrics snapshots in memory/campaigns branch

cursor-glob.description: Glob pattern to locate a durable cursor/checkpoint file in memory/campaigns branch

owners.description: Primary human owners for this campaign

allowed-safe-outputs.description: Safe-outputs operations this campaign is expected to use

launcher.description: Optional launcher layer configuration. When omitted, the launcher is enabled by default.

enabled.description: Whether to generate and compile the campaign launcher workflow

governance.description: Lightweight pacing and opt-out policies for campaign coordinator workflows (launcher/orchestrator)

max-new-items-per-run.description: Maximum number of new items (issues/PRs) the launcher should add to the Project board per run

max-discovery-items-per-run.description: Maximum number of candidate issues/PRs to scan during discovery in a single run

max-discovery-pages-per-run.description: Maximum number of result pages to fetch during discovery in a single run

opt-out-labels.description: Labels that opt an issue/PR out of campaign tracking

do-not-downgrade-done-items.description: If true, prevent moving Project status backwards (e.g., Done -> In Progress) when issues/PRs are reopened

max-project-updates-per-run.description: Maximum number of update-project safe-output operations per run for generated coordinator workflows

max-comments-per-run.description: Maximum number of add-comment safe-output operations per run for generated coordinator workflows
